page.title: 17SHOTESHAM/HOWE RELIGION
page.content: The villages of Howe and Shotesham are the 2 centres of Religion in the area. SHOTESHAM Both the Church of England and the Methodist denominations have buildings. Each one holding{SUNDAY {SERVICES}but neither having a resident vicar, the Methodist minister visits from Norwich and the Church of England vicar being shared with the adjacent parish of Saxlingham. There is a burial ground at the church used by both denominations. Christenings, marriages and funeral services are held infrequently throughout the year. A village weekend{FESTIVAL}is organised every 4 years to fund_raise for the maintenance of 2 Churches,1 of which is out of the area, and Chapel HOWE The tower of the Church of St. Mary is believed to be one of the 3 { {OLDEST}in England. The vicar visits twice a month from Poringland.
